Because works great with SC. All the effects in-game are similar to a anamorphic cinema lens... flares, glares, Bokeh, distortion etc. I'm not sure if is something intentional from the artistic team but feels pretty natural and accurate.
Still looking great, maybe better for stills, more clean, the screenshot is a part of a video i'm editing. https://imgur.com/7CdDyco

Lol, I just put the black bars for fun, Black Bars are not cheap. Just a few points ... -You see black bars because is the only way to watch a movie filmed on 1.85 (small black bars) or 2.35 (big black bars) aspect ratio without losing Frame or quality -Films listed as 1.78:1 are the only one you can watch on a 16:9 screen without losing quality. -Big blockbuster and most of the films still using 2.35:1 or 2.40:1 aspect ratio. So we're watching movies at the wrong ratio and at the wrong resolution if you don't see black bars

WRITING.TITLE: Welcome Black. The ultimate farmer + fun !

WRITING.TEXT: I'm destroying like 2 dd's per match giving my teams a great advantage, Is brutal in close fights... When you engage and enemy dd's pop smoke you have a extra time to finish them off using the radar, is a great feeling. I'm putting more torps than I expected to be honest, especially defending caps and obviously in close quarters. Low speed but the concelament is great. I'm having a ton of fun!
Totally agree, i get the flint reaching rank 1 in the first ranked seasons and still having loads of fun with her...Is really unique and yes...dirty af
And another funny thing I noticed, Slow Torps confuse people and sometimes fail to predict when to turn or stop to dodge :P
Remember the Black have Smoke + Radar. Chung mu and YueY can't mount both consumables at the same time. That's why the nerf on YY was so unnecessary. Damn...I miss my old Yue :(

Even with snowflakes and stuff you need to play Clan Battles or Ranked (successfully) to get One of those. So don't expect **everyone** getting one...and there are more factors...People saving for Stalingrad and the upcoming Steel cruisers (Wichita, Azuma etc) and people using steel to get Salem, Jean Bart and Musashi. You are right, Not my intention to being rude but I was. My apologies My tip is to try to avoid to play her too stationary, I saw a lot of players using Missouri like a Yamato or Musashi, too stationary and only bow tanking from far, if you play like that you're not using all his strenghts. For me is more like a fast flanker, I play her mostly like a High tier French BB, using speed, accuracy and radar as a advantage, plus a decent concelament for a big BB. #8203; I always try to help my team first instead of farm damage, radaring smokes and contested caps and shooting as soon as you can enemy cruisers (You dont have the crazy overpen like Musashi so you can score more citadels) #8203; So in resume. 1-Use speed (Is really fast) and flank 2-Help team first, radar after cruisers and don't go only for the big boys, even if they're a shooting at you. 3-Cruiser is your priority objetive on early-mid match. #8203; I have 60,5% winrate and 88 k average damage over 250 battles. #8203;

Fire prevention is mandatory Clearly is the most skill dependent of all tier X BB's by far, but when is working is formidable. #8203; Don't give up! :P

WRITING.TITLE: Thank you Mogador for making my ranked season fun again (From R6 to R3 without losing a star)

WRITING.TEXT: Is a nice pick. Awesome map control and you can murder any DD in seconds if you pick the right fights at the right moment...and more important, Is fun as hell to play. #8203; #8203; Disclaimer: Some battles missing due to Client restart.
Exactly 3 bundles. 3 k Doubloons, pretty lucky :p

DM is a DPM monster and have a crazy survivability if you get a good position. #8203; Some good tips that worked for me: \- Play slow and careful, but not too much, try to get a safe position at the start but be sure to have line of fire on caps before popping your radar, this thing Murder DD's at close ranges. \- Don't be afraid to use AP, angles are good and can pen a lot of things in a lot of angles. \- I like to play aggressive so Reload Module is better than Range mod is most cases...but this depends on you playstyle. \- DM's are not just Island campers, in good conditions you can push really affectively in open water or Kite a bit to retreat or relocate. \- Gun arcs, like other USA ships are suborbital, use it from cover, but like i said, don't camp too much or you will lose the Utility of the ship itself.
I get 3 missions plus the Sirocco form the last directive, played all my ships and have 200 Tokens left. How many ships you played?

WRITING.TEXT: All people comenting looks like are not playing it so as a owner This is my opinion I like it a lot, for me worth the Free XP, I'm DD main so instant pick for me. My stats now with her are 66K Average Damage and 59 % WR (Not much on 15 battles but i can see the potencial) Pros: \- Guns are awesome, with cpt. skills plus mod you can reach 1,4 Secs reloading...also, ballistic are pretty ok, at close and medium ranges are lasers. \- 5 km Hydro + Smoke, if you like KMS DD's you know what I mean. \- Tier IX premium: Good trainer, Good creadit earning potential. \- Decent HP pool. With SE is sitting around 21 K hp, I don't remember exactly. \- AA is Godlike, not tested in deep, but probably as good as Grozovoy/Neutrashimi if not better. Cosn: \- American smoke, last 2 minutes but the cooldown is really long, Losing a smoke hurts a lot \- Speed a rudder are meh, turning circle is average \- Looks like takes ages to accel, propulsion module looks like a good idea \- No torps, you are in trouble if a Bigger ships rush you or catch you off guard \- Basically is a DD hunter and HE spammer, some people can find this type of gameplay a bit Dull.
I'm not Glossing, I'm just giving my opinion based on my own gameplay. Every Cpt. with 19 points on a good ship is a Good trainer :)
Not all, Only the good ships.
I'm playing it Without IFHE now and My damage is almost the same, Demo expert can be a bit overkill but I want to test it anyway for fun!
Well done! What is your Cpt Build?
Sometimes is effective if the BB is focused and trying to go to a safer position. But yeah, you're a good guy :)

Are not comparable, total different playstyles. US DD'S are based on versatility and IJN gunboats are based on insane DPM. French DD's are based on Speed and Ballistics, you can engage, pop Reload booster and murder any other DD (and some cruisers) and use your speed to disengage. Torps are good too, fast and hits hard, I love to use them Rushing smokes or killing Wounded BB's. IMO you can only compare French DD's to Russian gunboats based on speed and long range HE spamming...is the closest Experience.

You have the concealment advantage most of the times (Except with the Khaba, Udaloi, Thaskent...) TBH the best way to face a French DD's is simple... Don't go toe to toe with them. I played a lot The French DD's (Currently in the top 20 EU Le terrible and Mogador) and the only way to get Killed easily is rushing Caps and getting trapped by Cruisers on early stages. Only Strong Gunboats on close Quarters with a good support are a problem. Edit: Of course they have Drawbacks...CV's are a problem and you don't have Heal or smoke like the Khaba and Daring, so you need to manage very carefully you HP pool

WRITING.TITLE: My first Salamander, with oils! (Wip)

WRITING.TEXT: Thank you! I'm using it mostly for washes, weathering and Highlights. I love the control you have over the color and the way you can make transitions between shadow and light...also you can correct any mistake with just one pass of white spirit with a brush. The major drawback is the dry time...depends of the oil and the amount of it but usually takes between 2 and 5 days :S
